title: High Electricity Bill Dispute
description: File complaint for incorrect or unusually high electricity bill
steps: Check meter reading on your electricity bill
Compare with previous 3 months bills
Take a clear photo of your electricity meter
Visit your State DISCOM website or nearest office
Register complaint online or fill physical form
Provide consumer number and bill details
Upload meter photo and past bills
Note down complaint number from acknowledgement
DISCOM will inspect within 7 days
Wait for resolution within 15 days
documents: Photo of meter showing current reading

title: No Power Supply / Frequent Power Cuts
title_hi: बिजली आपूर्ति नहीं / बार-बार बिजली कटौती
description: Report complete power outage or frequent power cuts
steps: Immediately call DISCOM helpline: 1912
Provide your consumer number and location
Note down the complaint reference number
If power not restored in 2 hours, call again
After 24 hours without resolution, visit DISCOM office
File written complaint with consumer number
Register complaint on CPGRAMS portal
Take photo of complaint receipt
Escalate after 3 days if no action taken

title: Meter Not Working / Faulty Meter
title_hi: मीटर काम नहीं कर रहा / खराब मीटर
description: Report electricity meter malfunction or damage
steps: Check if meter display is working
Note meter number from your bill
Call DISCOM helpline and report meter fault
Visit DISCOM office with consumer number
Submit application for meter testing
DISCOM will inspect meter within 7 days
If meter found faulty, replacement done free
If meter working, testing charges apply (₹100-200)
New meter installed within 15 days

title: Online Fraud / Cybercrime Complaint
description: Report online fraud, UPI scam, phishing, or cyber crimes
steps: IMMEDIATELY block your bank account/card - Call bank
Visit https://cybercrime.gov.in
Click 'Report Cybercrime' button
Select complaint category (Financial Fraud/Social Media Crime)
Fill complete details: transaction ID, amount, date/time
Upload ALL evidence: screenshots, emails, chat messages
Submit and note down complaint number
You will receive acknowledgement on email/SMS
If fraud amount > ₹50,000, also visit local cyber police station
Follow up after 15 days if no response

title: Police Refusing to File FIR
title_hi: पुलिस एफआईआर दर्ज करने से मना कर रही है
description: What to do when police station refuses to register FIR
steps: Note the date, time, and officer name who refused FIR
Write your complaint on plain paper clearly
Visit police station with 2 copies
Request to file FIR under relevant sections
If refused, get in writing WHY they are refusing
Send complaint via Registered Post to Superintendent of Police (SP)
Register complaint on CPGRAMS portal
Send copy to District Magistrate (DM)
Can approach Judicial Magistrate directly under CrPC 156(3)
Can also file complaint on local police website
Follow up after 7 days

title: Women Helpline / Harassment Complaint
description: Report harassment, domestic violence, stalking, or seek help
steps: Call 181 Women Helpline (24x7, free)
Explain your situation clearly
They will guide you on next steps
If immediate danger, call 112 (Emergency)
Visit nearest Women Police Station or regular station
File complaint/FIR with details
Request for female officer if comfortable
Police will provide protection if needed
Register on NCW portal: ncw.nic.in for legal help
Can also approach District Legal Services Authority for free legal aid
source: NCW + Ministry of Women & Child Development

title: Unauthorized Transaction in Bank Account
description: Fraudulent or unauthorized debit from bank account
steps: IMMEDIATELY call bank customer care (number on back of card)
Request to BLOCK your account/card/UPI immediately
Note down complaint reference number
Within 3 days, visit your bank branch
Fill 'Unauthorised Transaction Dispute Form'
Attach bank statement highlighting fraud transaction
Attach your written complaint letter
Bank MUST respond within 30 days as per RBI guidelines
If no response in 30 days, register complaint on RBI CMS Portal: cms.rbi.org.in
If fraud > ₹1 lakh, file police complaint also
Keep all receipts and complaint numbers

title: Credit Card Disputed Charges / Billing Error
title_hi: क्रेडिट कार्ड विवादित शुल्क / बिलिंग त्रुटि
description: Incorrect charges on credit card or billing disputes
steps: Check credit card statement carefully
Identify disputed transaction(s)
Call credit card customer care WITHIN 60 days of transaction
Raise dispute for specific transaction
Note complaint reference number
Send written dispute letter to bank within 7 days
Bank will initiate investigation (can take 90 days)
During investigation, you don't have to pay disputed amount
Bank will reverse charges if fraud proven
If bank rejects, escalate to RBI Ombudsman
Keep all communication records
contact_numbers: Card customer care (on back of card)

title: EPF Withdrawal Delay / Not Processed
title_hi: ईपीएफ निकासी में देरी / प्रक्रिया नहीं हुई
description: PF withdrawal claim not processed or delayed
steps: Login to EPFO portal: unifiedportal-mem.epfindia.gov.in
Go to 'Track Claim Status'
Enter claim number or UAN
Check current status and reason for delay
If pending > 20 days, register grievance
Click 'Register Grievance' on EPFO portal
Provide claim details and issue description
Upload Aadhaar, bank details if not linked
You can also call EPFO helpline: 1800-118-005
Escalate to Regional PF Commissioner if no response in 30 days
Can approach EPF Tribunal for legal action

title: Defective Product Complaint / Warranty Issue
description: Product is defective, not working, or warranty claim rejected
steps: Contact seller/manufacturer FIRST via email/call
Request replacement or refund with purchase bill
Give them 7 days to respond
If no response, call National Consumer Helpline: 1800-11-4000
Register complaint on consumerhelpline.gov.in
Upload product details, bill, photos of defect
NCH will mediate with company
Wait 30 days for resolution
If still not resolved, file complaint in District Consumer Forum
Consumer forum filing fee: ₹200-5000 depending on claim
Can file online: edaakhil.nic.in

title: E-commerce Refund Not Received / Order Issue
title_hi: ई-कॉमर्स रिफंड नहीं मिला / ऑर्डर समस्या
description: Online shopping refund pending or order issue not resolved
steps: Check order status on app/website
Contact customer care via app chat or helpline
Request escalation if agent unhelpful
Send email to grievance officer (check website footer)
If no response in 48 hours, call NCH: 1800-11-4000
Register complaint on consumerhelpline.gov.in
Upload order details, payment proof, communication screenshots
Tag the e-commerce company in complaint
If refund > ₹10,000 and not resolved, file police complaint for fraud
Can also file in consumer forum

title: Overcharging / Wrong Billing / MRP Violation
title_hi: अधिक चार्ज / गलत बिलिंग / एमआरपी उल्लंघन
description: Charged more than MRP or wrong billing at shop/restaurant
steps: Check MRP printed on product package
If charged more, ask for bill with shop details
Politely inform shopkeeper about MRP violation
If they refuse to refund, take photo of bill and product
File complaint with Legal Metrology Department of your state
Visit: consumeraffairs.nic.in → State Departments
Can also call NCH: 1800-11-4000
Submit complaint with bill and product photo
Department will inspect and fine the shop
You can get refund + penalty amount sometimes

title: How to File RTI Application
description: Step-by-step process to file RTI and get government information
steps: Visit RTI online portal: rtionline.gov.in
Click 'Submit Request'
Select department and ministry
Identify correct Public Information Officer (PIO)
Write SPECIFIC questions (not vague or general)
Example: 'Provide copy of tender document for project X dated Y'
NOT: 'Give all information about project'
Pay ₹10 fee online (₹2 for BPL applicants)
Submit application
Note application number
Response MUST come within 30 days
If no response in 30 days, file First Appeal

title: File First Appeal if RTI Response Not Received
title_hi: यदि आरटीआई प्रतिक्रिया नहीं मिली तो प्रथम अपील दायर करें
description: What to do when PIO doesn't respond to RTI within 30 days
steps: Wait 30 days from RTI filing date
Login to rtionline.gov.in
Click 'File First Appeal'
Enter your RTI application number
State reason: 'No response received within 30 days'
No fee required for First Appeal
First Appellate Authority has 45 days to decide
They will order PIO to provide information
PIO can be penalized ₹250/day for delay
If First Appeal also rejected, file Second Appeal to Information Commission

title: Railway Ticket Refund / Cancellation
description: Cancel railway ticket and get refund
steps: Login to IRCTC website or app
Go to 'Booked Ticket History'
Select ticket to cancel
Click 'Cancel' before chart preparation
Cancellation charges apply based on timing:
- 48+ hours before: Minimum charges (₹240-400)
- Less than 48 hours: Higher charges
- After chart preparation: Only 50% refund with certificate
For TDR (after journey): File TDR within 3 days if train late >3 hours
Login → TDR → Fill form → Submit proof
Refund processed in 7-10 days to original payment source
For tickets booked at counter, visit station for refund

title: Railway Complaint / Poor Service / Cleanliness
description: Complain about train service, cleanliness, staff behavior
steps: Use RailMadad for ALL railway complaints
Method 1: SMS '139' with complaint to 139
Method 2: Call 139 helpline
Method 3: Visit railmadad.indianrailways.gov.in
Method 4: RailMadad mobile app
Provide: PNR/train number, coach number, specific issue
Take photos of issue if possible
Complaint number generated immediately
Railway responds within 2-4 hours for urgent issues
For non-urgent: 24-48 hours
Rate the response after resolution

title: Mobile Network Issue / Call Drop / Internet Problem
title_hi: मोबाइल नेटवर्क समस्या / कॉल ड्रॉप / इंटरनेट समस्या
description: Poor network, frequent call drops, slow internet speed
steps: Test network in different locations to confirm issue
Restart phone and toggle airplane mode
Check if bill payment is due
Call customer care: Airtel-121, Jio-1991, Vi-199
Register network complaint
If not resolved in 3 days, register on DoT portal
Visit: pgportal.gov.in → Select DoT
Or visit: sancharsaathi.gov.in
Provide mobile number, location, issue details
DoT will direct operator to resolve within 7 days
If still not resolved, escalate to TRAI

title: Mobile Bill Wrong Charges / Billing Dispute
title_hi: मोबाइल बिल गलत शुल्क / बिलिंग विवाद
description: Incorrect charges on mobile bill or disputed amounts
steps: Check detailed bill on operator app/website
Identify wrong charges clearly
Call customer care and raise billing dispute
Request itemized breakdown of charges
If not satisfied, email nodal officer
Nodal officer details on operator website
If no response in 7 days, register on DoT portal
Or register complaint on pgportal.gov.in
Can withhold disputed amount (not entire bill)
Operator must respond within 30 days
If rejected, can approach TRAI or Consumer Forum

title: Passport Application Delay / Status Check
title_hi: पासपोर्ट आवेदन में देरी / स्थिति जांच
description: Passport not received after application or excessive delay
steps: Check status online: passportindia.gov.in/AppOnlineProject/statusTracker/trackStatusInpNew
Enter file number and date of birth
Check current status stage
Normal processing time: 30-45 days
Tatkal: 7-10 days
If delay is more than expected time:
Call Passport Seva helpline: 1800-258-1800
Visit Passport Seva Kendra with appointment
If police verification pending > 45 days, contact local police station
Register complaint on pgportal.gov.in if no response
Select Ministry of External Affairs

title: Police Verification Pending / Delay
description: Police verification not done causing passport delay
steps: Check passport application status online
If status shows 'Police Verification Initiated'
Wait for police officer to visit your address
They may call you to police station instead
If no contact in 15 days, call local police station
Provide your file number to SHO
Request to expedite verification
If police asks for 'fees', this is illegal - report it
Call Passport Seva helpline: 1800-258-1800
They will coordinate with police
Can register complaint if delay > 45 days

title: Garbage Not Collected / Sanitation Issue
title_hi: कचरा नहीं उठाया गया / स्वच्छता समस्या
description: Municipal garbage not collected, overflowing bins, sanitation issues
steps: Note down your area/ward number
Call municipal corporation helpline (varies by city)
Register complaint for garbage collection
Take photo of garbage pile with location
If no action in 48 hours, register on:
MyGov: mygov.in OR
CPGRAMS: pgportal.gov.in (Select Urban Development)
Tweet/post on social media tagging municipal corporation
Can also use Swachh Bharat app
File RTI asking about sanitation schedule if chronic issue
Attend ward committee meeting to raise issue

title: Water Supply Issue / No Water
title_hi: पानी की आपूर्ति समस्या / पानी नहीं आ रहा
description: Municipal water not supplied, low pressure, contaminated water
steps: Call municipal water department helpline
Provide your house number and area
Register complaint for water supply issue
Take photo/video of dry tap or issue
If issue not resolved in 24 hours:
Visit ward office and file written complaint
Register on city municipal corporation portal
Or register on pgportal.gov.in
Select 'Urban Development' or 'Jal Jeevan Mission'
For contaminated water, also inform health department
Can file RTI for water supply schedule

title: Road Repair / Pothole Complaint
description: Damaged road, potholes, need road repair
steps: Take clear photo of pothole/damaged road
Note exact location (road name, landmark)
Register complaint on municipal app if available
Or call municipal helpline
Can also tweet with photo tagging municipal corporation
Register on pgportal.gov.in → Urban Development
For state highways: Register with PWD department
For national highways: Contact NHAI
Follow up after 15 days if no action
Can file PIL in High Court for chronic issues
documents: Photo of damaged road with location visible

title: Driving License Issue / Not Received
description: Driving license not received after test or DL issues
steps: Check status on Parivahan portal: parivahan.gov.in/rcdlstatus
Enter application number and date of birth
Normal DL issuance time: 30 days from test
If delay > 30 days:
Visit RTO office where you applied
Meet Licensing Officer with receipt
If no response, register grievance on parivahan.gov.in
Click 'Grievance Redressal' → File complaint
Or register on pgportal.gov.in → Road Transport
Can also call state transport helpline
Keep all receipts and test pass certificate

title: Vehicle RC Transfer / Ownership Transfer
description: Transfer vehicle ownership or RC after buying used vehicle
steps: Buyer and seller both must visit RTO together
Or use online transfer on parivahan.gov.in
Required documents: Sale agreement, old RC, insurance, PUC
Pay transfer fees (varies ₹300-1000 by state)
Submit Form 29 (NOC from seller) and Form 30 (transfer application)
RTO will verify documents
If interstate transfer, get NOC from original RTO first
New RC issued in 15-30 days
Track status on parivahan.gov.in
If delay, visit RTO or register grievance

title: Traffic Challan Dispute / Wrong Challan
description: Received wrong traffic challan or want to dispute
steps: Check challan details on parivahan.gov.in or state eChallan portal
Enter vehicle number to see all challans
If challan is wrong (wrong vehicle, paid already, etc.):
Collect evidence: photos, payment receipts, alibis
Visit traffic police station that issued challan
Submit written representation with evidence
Or file online dispute on eChallan portal if available
Police will review and cancel if genuine error
If rejected, can approach court
Pay challan promptly to avoid penalty increase
If you disagree but can't prove, pay and avoid court hassle
documents: Evidence of error (photos, receipts, GPS data)
source: Motor Vehicles Act + State Traffic Rules

title: College/School Fee Refund Not Received
description: Fee refund pending from educational institution
steps: Check refund policy in admission brochure/prospectus
Write application to Principal/Head with:
Admission number, fee receipt copy, reason for leaving
Request refund as per policy with bank details
Give college 30 days to process
If no response, send legal notice through lawyer
File complaint with University/Education Board
For professional colleges: Approach AICTE/UGC
File consumer complaint as education is a service
Register on pgportal.gov.in → Education Ministry
